metadata.title: CVE-2019-0155 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Insufficient access control in a subsystem for Intel (R) processor graphicsin 6th, 7th, 8th and 9th Generation Intel(R) Core(TM) Processor Families;Intel(R) Pentium(R) Processor J, N, Silver and Gold Series; Intel(R)Celeron(R) Processor J, N, G3900 and G4900 Series; Intel(R) Atom(R)Processor A and E3900 Series; Intel(R) Xeon(R) Processor E3-1500 v5 and v6,E-2100 and E-2200 Processor Families; Intel(R) Graphics Driver for Windowsbefore 26.20.100.6813 (DCH) or 26.20.100.6812 and before 21.20.x.5077(aka15.45.5077), i915 Linux Driver for Intel(R) Processor Graphics beforeversions 5.4-rc7, 5.3.11, 4.19.84, 4.14.154, 4.9.201, 4.4.201 may allow anauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via localaccess.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0155` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-169-generic - 4.4.0-169.198
linux-image-4.4.0-169-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-169.198
linux-image-4.4.0-169-lowlatency - 4.4.0-169.198
linux-image-4.4.0-169-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-169.198
linux-image-4.4.0-169-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-169.198
linux-image-4.4.0-169-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-169.198
linux-image-4.4.0-169-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-169.198
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-169-generic - 4.4.0-169.198
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-169-lowlatency - 4.4.0-169.198
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1126-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1126.135
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1130-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1130.138
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1099-aws - 4.4.0-1099.110
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-70-generic - 4.15.0-70.79~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-70-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-70.79~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-70-lowlatency - 4.15.0-70.79~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-70-generic - 4.15.0-70.79~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-70-lowlatency - 4.15.0-70.79~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1064-azure - 4.15.0-1064.69
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1050-gcp - 4.15.0-1050.53
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1063-kvm - 4.4.0-1063.70
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1056-aws - 4.15.0-1056.58~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1030-oracle - 4.15.0-1030.33~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-169.198').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.135').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1130.138').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1099.110').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-70.79~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1064.69').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1050.53').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1063.70').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.58~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.33~16.04.1').
